definition: to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: And the NMD program is, in essence, an U.S. program of unilateral nuclear expansion, which harbors the inherent danger of triggering an arms race at a higher level.
sentences.chinese: 美國此舉顯然孕育着引發更高水平上軍備競賽的危險。

sentences.english: The crack initiation time determined the composite's toughness.
sentences.chinese: 木粉對裂紋引發時間的影響最爲顯著。

sentences.english: Looking at the artistic creations of Pan Li-hong gave rise to a series of thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 看了潘麗紅的美術創作，引發一連串的思考。

sentences.english: The research could lead to new therapies for preventing cancer metastasis.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究將會引發癌轉移的新療法。

sentences.english: It seems likely that this protein will attract a great deal more analgesic research.
sentences.chinese: 這種蛋白質可能會引發更多的鎮痛劑研究。

sentences.english: This will initiate a neurological chain reaction that will help move us in the right direction.
sentences.chinese: 這將引發一些列能將我們引導到正確方向的連鎖反應。

sentences.english: The flooding reignites one of the key debates over the construction of the Three Gorges Dam.
sentences.chinese: 洪災重新引發了就建設三峽大壩的主要爭議之一。

sentences.english: The virus triggered myocarditis, a serious inflammation of the heart muscle.
sentences.chinese: 這些病毒引發心肌炎，對心臟肌肉造成嚴重的炎症。

sentences.english: S. was considering compulsory Iraq service for its diplomatic corps, but thee-mails sparked outrage nevertheless.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這些電子郵件還是引發了一片憤怒。

sentences.english: This makes you pause for a minute and think.
sentences.chinese: 這讓你停頓了一下，並引發了你的思考。

sentences.english: A bad padlock invites a picklock.
sentences.chinese: 一個劣質的掛鎖引發一個撬鎖者。

sentences.english: It could aggravate the symptoms by amplifying the very inflammatory agents that cause them.
sentences.chinese: 這會增加引發這些症狀的炎性因子進而加劇症狀。

sentences.english: The psychological effects often exacerbate health problems that the physiological stress response has already caused.
sentences.chinese: 心理作用通常加劇了生理負擔早已引發的健康問題。

sentences.english: Gaudy art caused a lot of disputes in society.
sentences.chinese: 豔俗藝術在社會上引發了許多爭論。

sentences.english: Aphrodite was the goddess who triggered the Trojan War.
sentences.chinese: 阿佛羅狄忒是引發特洛伊戰爭的女神。

sentences.english: Mr Obama's agricultural policies also resonate beyond rural counties.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬的農業政策同樣在農業縣外引發共鳴。

definition: to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
to arise/to come into being/to come about/to give rise to/to bring into being/to bring about/to produce/to engender/to generate/to appear/appearance/emergence/generation/production/yield
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to happen/to occur/to take place/to break out
to target/to focus on/to be aimed at or against/in response to
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to break out/to erupt/to explode/to burst out
